JobTitle: Senior Software Engineer- Financial Data Engineering
JobFullDesc:
We are looking for a highly skilled and enthusiastic senior backend ETL and Java engineer to join our fast-paced, dynamic technology team responsible for delivering high quality technical solution.  You will be joining a UK based team driving the next generation regulatory reporting transformation for the American Express International Finance and Controllership organization. 
This is an exciting opportunity to work within a small highly skilled dynamic team.  This role will provide you with opportunities to innovate, work across multiple tech stacks, and move our platforms to the next generation of microservices and OneAmex capabilities. 

The senior engineer will be part of the UK based Finance Data Engineering team responsible for the following:
Tech stack characteristics:
Java 8 and Kafka
REST API 
Scalable applications running on Vert.x, Spring Boot or similar
Relational Databases: Oracle, Postgres
Bigdata Platform/PySpark/Hive
NoSQL: Redis, Couchbase, Cassandra
High performance cloud infrastructure (PaaS)
ETL tools - Informatica and Talend
Distinct advantage to have Java microservices and component architecture
Responsibilities Include:
Design and coding of user stories for distributed scalable, high performance and systems using Java
Debug software components and identify code defects for remediation
Contribute to the deployment, support and monitoring of software across test, integration and production environments
Collaborate with peer technology and development teams across different locations
Have excellent written and verbal communications skills
Help architect new solutions and services

This role may be subject to additional background verification checks.
The ideal candidate:

Has hands-on expertise with Java application design, software development and automated testing
Worked in an agile delivery team and is familiar with the processes and ceremonies
Has a drive to learn industry leading/innovative technologies and solutions
Is open to innovation and experimentation, engage in fun and outcome-oriented culture, and is always ready to try new concepts without fear of failure
Is team-oriented, and a core contributor, enabling the team to be more effective and productive

Qualifications:

University Degree in computer science, computer engineering or equivalent experience
Significant of hands-on experience on enterprise software development.
Medium to advanced technical skills in the areas of microservices, APIs and Java 8

Desired:

Knowledge in microservices using RESTFul APIs and relational/NoSQL databases
Designing and building Cloud native applications for cloud platforms using Docker, Kubernetes and OpenShift
Good understanding of Data Warehouse concepts
Some hands-on experience with ETL tools such as Informatica or Talend an advantage
Understanding of Financial accounting and Reporting an advantage
